verses.text: The vision of Isaiah the son of Amoz, which he saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah.
Hear, O heavens, and give ear, O earth;
“Children  have I reared and brought up,
The ox knows its owner,
but Israel does not know,
Ah, sinful nation,
offspring of evildoers,
they have despised the Holy One of Israel,
they are utterly estranged.
Why will you still be struck down?
Why will you continue to rebel?
From the sole of the foot even to the head,
they are not pressed out or bound up
Your country lies desolate;
And the daughter of Zion is left
like a booth in a vineyard,
If the Lord of hosts
had not left us a few survivors,
we should have been like Sodom,
and become like Gomorrah.
Hear the word of the Lord ,
you rulers of Sodom!
Give ear to the teaching of our God,
you people of Gomorrah!
“What to me is the multitude of your sacrifices?
“When you come to appear before me,
Bring no more vain offerings;
New moon and Sabbath and the calling of convocations—
I cannot endure iniquity and solemn assembly.
Your new moons and your appointed feasts
When you spread out your hands,
even though you make many prayers,
your hands are full of blood.
Wash yourselves; make yourselves clean;
cease to do evil,
learn to do good;
seek justice,
bring justice to the fatherless,
“Come now, let us reason together, says the Lord :
they shall be as white as snow;
If you are willing and obedient,
but if you refuse and rebel,
for the mouth of the Lord has spoken.”
How the faithful city
has become a whore,
she who was full of justice!
Your silver has become dross,
Your princes are rebels
Everyone loves a bribe
They do not bring justice to the fatherless,
Therefore the Lord declares,
the Mighty One of Israel:
and avenge myself on my foes.
I will turn my hand against you
and will smelt away your dross as with lye
And I will restore your judges as at the first,
Afterward you shall be called the city of righteousness,
Zion shall be redeemed by justice,
But rebels and sinners shall be broken together,
For they shall be ashamed of the oaks
and you shall blush for the gardens
For you shall be like an oak
And the strong shall become tinder,
with none to quench them.
